name: lookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Looks up a system property by its key.
 *
 * @param key the key of the system property to look up
 * @return the value of the system property, or {@code null} if it does not exist,
 *         is empty, or an error occurs while accessing the property
 * @throws SecurityException if access to the property is denied due to security restrictions
 */

signature: public static <V> StrLookup<V> mapLookup(final Map<String, V> map)
name: mapLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a {@link StrLookup} instance that maps string keys to values from the provided map.
 *
 * @param map the map containing key-value pairs, where each key is a string and each value is of type V
 * @return a new instance of {@link MapStrLookup} initialized with the given map
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a StrLookup instance that maps string keys to values from the provided map.
 *
 * @param <V> the type of the values in the map
 * @param map the map containing key-value pairs, where each key is a string and each value is of type V
 * @return a new instance of MapStrLookup initialized with the given map
 */

name: noneLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a lookup that always returns an empty string.
 *
 * @return A lookup that always returns an empty string.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a lookup function that always returns an empty string, regardless of the input key.
 *
 * @return A lookup function that always returns an empty string.
 */

signature: public static StrLookup<String> resourceBundleLookup(final ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
name: resourceBundleLookup
javadoc: /** * Returns a lookup that retrieves strings from the specified ResourceBundle. * * @param resourceBundle the ResourceBundle to retrieve strings from * @return a lookup that retrieves strings from the specified ResourceBundle */
improved_javadoc: /** * Returns a lookup that retrieves strings from the specified ResourceBundle. * * This method creates and returns a lookup object that can be used to retrieve localized string values * from the provided ResourceBundle. The lookup object will use the keys of the * ResourceBundle as the keys for the lookup. * * @param resourceBundle the non-null ResourceBundle to retrieve strings from * @return a non-null lookup that retrieves strings from the specified ResourceBundle */

name: systemPropertiesLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a lookup that maps property names to their corresponding values
 * from the system properties.
 *
 * @return A lookup that maps property names to their corresponding values
 *         from the system properties.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a lookup that maps property names to their corresponding values 
 * from the system properties, including both system and user-defined properties.
 *
 * @return A lookup that maps property names to their corresponding values 
 *         from the system properties. The returned lookup will contain all 
 *         system properties (e.g., java.home) as well as any user-defined 
 *         properties (e.g., my.property).
 */
